conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_D. Nursery_B is my first-choice nursery, and I’m very eager to enroll if possible. I would be committed to accepting a place if offered. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is Nursery_B. Although Nursery_B ranks me relatively low (4th), applying immediately maximizes my chance in case higher-priority parents choose other nurseries first. Waiting would only reduce my odds of securing my first choice.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_D, thank you for your application and for sharing that Nursery_B is your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round and given our limited availability, we’re not able to offer you a place at Nursery_B. We wish you the very best with your other options.
conversation.thought: As Nursery_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from C, D, and A. Among these, Parent_C is ranked higher than Parent_D, and I have quota 1. Since accepting Parent_D now would lock my only seat and prevent matching with a higher-priority applicant already available (Parent_C), I should reject Parent_D.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B—I'm Parent_A. I’m applying because Nursery_B is my first-choice nursery. I’m very committed to enrolling if offered a place and can confirm promptly. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is Nursery_B, so I should apply immediately. Although Nursery_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying only increases the risk it fills with higher-priority applicants (Parent_E, Parent_B, Parent_C, Parent_D). An early, clear application is my best chance to secure my first choice; if rejected, I can move quickly to Nursery_C next round.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_A, thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in Nursery_B. After reviewing applications received this round and given our very limited availability, we’re not able to offer you a place at Nursery_B at this time. We sincerely appreciate your interest and wish you the best with your other nursery options.
conversation.thought: Nursery_B has quota 1 and true priority order: Parent_E > Parent_B > Parent_C > Parent_D > Parent_A. In this round, applicants are Parent_C, Parent_D, Parent_A. Among them, Parent_C is highest on our list, so we should not accept Parent_A now. We already rejected Parent_D earlier; regardless, Parent_C dominates both D and A in our priority. There is also a chance Parent_B or Parent_E may apply in later rounds, so keeping the seat open is strategically better than accepting our lowest-ranked listed parent. Therefore reject Parent_A politely.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_C and Nursery_B is my first choice. I’m very eager to enroll with you and can fully commit to your schedule and requirements. If selected, we would accept immediately and be ready with all paperwork. Thank you for considering my application. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is Nursery_B. Although Nursery_B’s priority ranks Parent_E and Parent_B ahead of me, applying immediately maximizes my chance before they secure other matches. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to encourage acceptance if they do not receive higher-priority applicants or if those applicants go elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_C, thank you for your application and for sharing your strong commitment to Nursery_B. We are pleased to offer you a place at Nursery_B. Please confirm your acceptance and we will send the next steps for enrollment and paperwork. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As Nursery_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received applications from D, A, and C. Among these, Parent_C is the highest on my priority list (rank 3), ahead of D (rank 4) and A (rank 5). Although my top two choices (Parent_E and Parent_B) did not apply this round, I have quota 1 and can secure a relatively high-priority match now rather than risk ending up with a lower-priority or no match later. Parent_C also states Nursery_B is their first choice and they will accept immediately, reducing commitment risk. Therefore I should accept Parent_C.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_B and I’d like to formally apply. Nursery_A is my first choice because it’s the best fit for our family’s location and program preferences, and we’re ready to accept a place if offered. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Nursery_A is my top true choice, so I should apply immediately. Although Nursery_A ranks me relatively low, applying now is still optimal because it maximizes my chance at my first choice before capacity is taken; if rejected, I can move to Nursery_B next round where I have strong priority.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_B, thank you for your application and for considering Nursery_A as your first choice. After reviewing current priorities and availability for this intake, we’re not able to offer you a place at Nursery_A at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your allocation process.
conversation.thought: Parent_B is applying and ranks 4th on Nursery_A’s true priority list (E, D, A, B, C). With quota 1 and only round 1, it is strategically better to reject Parent_B now and keep the seat available for higher-priority candidates (especially Parent_E or Parent_D) who are likely to apply elsewhere first but may come to Nursery_A later (Nursery_A is Parent_E’s 3rd choice and Parent_D’s 3rd choice). Accepting Parent_B immediately would block the possibility of matching with a higher-priority parent.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_E. Nursery_C is my first choice, and I’d be very happy to accept a place if offered. I’m ready to confirm promptly and can provide any required documents or information right away. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice, Nursery_C, immediately. Although Nursery_C prioritizes Parent_B/C/D ahead of me, an early application gives me the best chance before capacity fills, and there is no downside in round 1 since I can move to my next choices if rejected.

conversation.message: Hello Parent_E, thank you for your application and for ranking Nursery_C as your first choice. At this stage we’re unable to offer you a place, as we need to prioritize other applicants under our admissions priority order. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is on my true priority list but ranked 4th (B, C, D ahead). I have quota 1 and it is only round 1; accepting now would block the possibility of matching with higher-priority Parents_B/Parent_C/Parent_D, all of whom rank Nursery_C as 2nd choice and may apply soon if their 1st-choice Nursery_B doesn’t accept them. Since I can only respond once per application and cannot hold, I should reject Parent_E now to preserve the chance to match higher on my list.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_D, I’m Parent_E. Nursery_D is one of my top choices, and I would be very happy to accept a place if offered. If you can offer me a spot, I’m ready to confirm immediately and provide any documents or information you need right away. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Nursery_C (my top choice) already rejected me, so I should move to my next highest remaining option: Nursery_D. Although Nursery_D ranks me 4th in its priority list, applying now is still optimal because it is my second choice and may still be available depending on other parents’ moves. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing readiness to accept immediately.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application, Parent_E. We’re pleased to offer you our available place at Nursery_D. Please confirm your acceptance and we will share the next steps and required documents for enrollment.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_D’s true priority list (behind Parent_D, Parent_A, Parent_C). I still have quota 1 and no current match. Given parents’ preferences, Parent_D and Parent_A rank Nursery_D last, so they are very unlikely to apply here unless rejected everywhere else; Parent_C ranks Nursery_D 3rd and may apply later; Parent_B ranks Nursery_D 4th and is last on my priority list. Since Parent_E is applying now and is within my acceptable set, accepting secures a decent match and avoids the risk of ending unmatched while waiting for higher-priority parents who may never come. Therefore accept Parent_E.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_B and I’d like to formally apply for your available place. After not receiving an offer from my first-choice nursery, Nursery_C is my top remaining choice and we would be very happy to accept immediately if offered. We’re ready to complete any required paperwork and can confirm our commitment right away. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Nursery_A (my top choice) already rejected me, so I should move to my next best available option. Nursery_B is my second choice but it is not in the remaining unmatched list, so I cannot approach it this round. Among the remaining options, Nursery_C is my highest-ranked (3rd). Also, Nursery_C’s priority list ranks me (Parent_B) first, so a formal application should be accepted if they still have capacity. I will send a clear [APPLY] and signal strong commitment to secure the match immediately.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_B, thank you for your application and for your interest in Nursery_C. We are pleased to offer you our available place. Please confirm your acceptance and we will send the next steps for enrollment paperwork and scheduling.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority order is B > C > D > E > A. In this round we received APPLY from B, A, and D. B is our top-ranked parent overall, so accepting B immediately secures the best possible match for us and avoids the risk of losing them to another nursery in subsequent rounds. No higher-priority candidate than B exists, so there is no benefit to delaying. We previously rejected E (ranked below D and above A), consistent with prioritizing higher-ranked applicants. Therefore, accept Parent_B now.

conversation.message: [APPLY] Dear Nursery_C, I’m Parent_A and I’d like to formally apply for your available place. Nursery_C is one of my top choices, and if offered admission I can confirm immediately and complete any required steps right away. Thank you very much for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Nursery_B (my top choice) already rejected me, so I should move to my next highest available option. Among the unmatched nurseries, Nursery_C is my second choice. Although Nursery_C ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still my best chance to secure a high-preference match before capacity fills, and I can signal strong commitment to improve my prospects if they have discretion among applicants.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_A, thank you very much for your application and for your interest in Nursery_C. Unfortunately, we are not able to offer you a place at this time because our available spot has already been filled. We appreciate you reaching out and wish you the very best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: Our quota is 0 because we already accepted Parent_B in round 1, establishing a match. Under the rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Even if we had capacity, Parent_A is lowest on our true priority list (after Parent_B, Parent_C, Parent_D, Parent_E), and there is also an [APPLY] from Parent_D this round who ranks higher than Parent_A. Therefore we must reject Parent_A due to no remaining places.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_D. Nursery_C is one of my top choices, and I would be very happy to enroll with you. I value a warm, structured environment and strong communication with families, and I’m ready to confirm immediately if offered a place. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_D, thank you very much for your application and for your interest in Nursery_C. Unfortunately, we’re unable to offer you a place at this time because our available spot has already been filled. We appreciate you reaching out and wish you the very best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: Parent_D is on our true priority list (ranked 3rd), but our quota is 1 and we have already accepted Parent_B (our top priority) earlier. With remaining quota = 0, we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of rank. Therefore, reject Parent_D and, if appropriate, encourage them to pursue other nurseries.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_D. I’m reaching out to formally apply—Nursery_A is one of my top remaining choices, and I would be ready to accept immediately if offered a place. conversation.thought: Nursery_A is higher on my true preference list than Nursery_E, and both are still unmatched. Since capacities are 1 and we are in round 3, I should apply immediately to my best remaining option. I will signal strong commitment and fit to maximize acceptance chances.

conversation.message:

Warm regards,
Nursery_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Nursery_A quota is 1. My true priority order is E > D > A > B > C. In this round I have applications from Parent_D and Parent_A. Parent_D ranks higher than Parent_A on my list, and Parent_D is applying with readiness to accept immediately. Although Parent_E is my top choice, they have not contacted me and they rank Nursery_A only 3rd (after C and D), so waiting risks ending unmatched or settling for a lower-priority parent later. Since accepting Parent_D secures my second-highest priority and fills the only seat, I should accept Parent_D now and reject any lower-priority applicants afterward.

Although Parent_A is on our true priority list, we cannot displace an existing match in this protocol, so we must reject Parent_A’s application while being polite and possibly offering to stay in touch if circumstances change.
